scenario_text.value:
Well, I’m sure we’re all pretty worn out, in
more ways than one. We should get some rest.
Yeah, I can barely stay on my feet.
Shuuji...what’s wrong?
Ugh... Stay away from me.
I’m sorry...

Uh, wait, am I missing something? You don’t
expect all of us to sleep in here, do you?
There’s plenty of space. What’s the problem?
Look at all these nice clean sheets, too.
No, I mean, boys and girls in the same room!
Oh...

Hey, don’t worry about it. We’ve got way
bigger problems than that right now.

Are you crazy? How is this something you
expect me to just not worry about?
Huh?!

Girls need privacy! What about when we need
to get changed or take a bath?

She does have a point. Up until now, I’ve
just been doing all that somewhere else.

What? So you boys had her go off on her own?
That’s awful! Show some consideration!
Yeah, you tell them, Saki!
Floramon, please do not make things worse.

But we never know when we might be attacked.
We thought it was safest to stick together.
Anywhere in the school would be fine!

Or is that your deviant little excuse to spy
on us while we get changed? Ugh, gross!
What?! Takuma?
No! It’s not like that at all!
What does she mean, “deviant”?

You don’t know, Agumon? It’s something that
differs from what is usual and stands out.

Like a caterpillar when it becomes a butterfly.
Isn’t that right, Kunemon?
Kew, kew?
Wow, you’re really smart.
That sounds like evolving!

Hee hee! If there’s ever anything you want to
know, just ask me!

No, I believe in this instance... On second
thought, never mind.
The point is, we should have separate rooms.

Honestly, I hadn’t really thought about it
before, but Saki’s right.
It seems like an obvious thing to me.

Hmph, like it even matters. We’re never
getting out of here... Never...

I feel like we’re being wrongly accused here.
Look, what do you think, Takuma?
(Separate rooms for boys and girls? Hmm...)
Saki’s right.
Safety in numbers.
Saki’s right.

Saki has a point. I feel like we’ve been
rude.
No, I should have said something.

Don’t blame yourself, Aoi. They’re the ones
who need to apologize.
Really, Saki, it’s okay.

As for where the two of you should sleep...
Haru, can I ask something?
Safety in numbers.

Like I said before, we might get attacked at
any time. There’s safety in numbers, right?

I don’t know... I think you’d need a lot of
guts to try and make that argument again.
And don’t let Saki hear you. She’d lose it.

Good point. In that case, Haru, can I ask you
something?

How would everybody feel if the girls slept
in the music room with Haru and Miyuki?
Miyuki’s a girl, and Haru’s still young.
I guess I’d be okay with that.
Yeah, me too.

Okay, so, would it be all right if these two
slept in the music room with you?
Yeah, sure.
Sure...
Thanks.
What? But we don’t...

(Hmm? Miyuki’s giving Haru some kind of
look...)
*sigh*... Fine. It’s okay, I guess.
Great, thanks a bunch.

(Did she convince him? She may be on the
quiet side, but she is the older of the two.)

All right, now seriously, let’s all get some
rest.
